after,null,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) starting strictly after the first $scope_mode$ interval and spanning to the end of the execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

after,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) starting strictly after the first $scope_mode$ interval and spanning to the end of the execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

before,regular,before,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and exclusive of) the first point where $scope_mode$ holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if $scope_mode$ never holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at least once strictly before the state where the stop condition holds. If the stop condition never occurs, RES does not need to hold. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is not satisified.

before,regular,for,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and exclusive of) the first point where $scope_mode$ holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if $scope_mode$ never holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the trigger and remain true for $duration$ time points past the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$), or to the end of the interval if the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$.

before,regular,until,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and exclusive of) the first point where $scope_mode$ holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if $scope_mode$ never holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever.  If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

in,null,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.

in,null,until,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever.  If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

in,null,within,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= $duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$, then RES need not hold.

in,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

in,regular,before,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at least once strictly before the state where the stop condition holds. If the stop condition never occurs, RES does not need to hold. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is not satisified.

ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).

in,regular,until,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever.  If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

in,regular,within,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= $duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$, then RES need not hold.

notin,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

notin,regular,for,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the trigger and remain true for $duration$ time points past the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$), or to the end of the interval if the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$.

notin,regular,within,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= $duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$, then RES need not hold.

null,null,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance $duration$+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+$duration$+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

null,null,always,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

null,null,before,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at least once strictly before the state where the stop condition holds. If the stop condition never occurs, RES does not need to hold. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is not satisified.

null,null,eventually,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

null,null,for,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the trigger and remain true for $duration$ time points past the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$), or to the end of the interval if the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$.

null,null,immediately,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

null,null,never,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

null,null,next,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the next time step.

null,null,null,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

null,null,until,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever.  If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= $duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+$duration$, then RES need not hold.

onlyAfter,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and including) the first interval where $scope_mode$ holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if $scope_mode$ never holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must either hold at some point with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$), or RES must remain false for $duration$+1 time points starting at the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$+1), or to the end of the interval if it ends sooner than trigger+$duration$+1.

onlyAfter,regular,for,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and including) the first interval where $scope_mode$ holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if $scope_mode$ never holds.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at some point with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$), except if the end of the interval occurs sooner.

REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at least once strictly before the state where the stop condition holds, or the end of the interval if the stop condition never holds.

onlyBefore,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) starting at the first point where $scope_mode$ holds and spanning to the end of the execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must either hold at some point with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$), or RES must remain false for $duration$+1 time points starting at the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$+1), or to the end of the interval if it ends sooner than trigger+$duration$+1.

onlyIn,regular,after,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must either hold at some point with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+$duration$), or RES must remain false for $duration$+1 time points starting at the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$+1), or to the end of the interval if it ends sooner than trigger+$duration$+1.

onlyIn,regular,before,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false until, but not necessarily including, the state where the stop condition holds. If the stop condition never occurs, RES can occur.

ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at least once strictly before the state where the stop condition holds, or the end of the interval if the stop condition never holds.

onlyIn,regular,within,satisfaction.description:
ENFORCED: in every interval where $scope_mode$ does NOT hold.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval if $regular_condition$ is true and any point in the interval where $regular_condition$ becomes true (from false).
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=$duration$ from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+$duration$), or until the end of the interval.
